reviews.review: Probably the best puzzle game ever when it came out

Increíble juego, obligatorio de jugar. Una historia que al comienzo no se sabe bien de que trata y se va esclareciendo conforme uno va avanzando por las distintas salas de un laboratorio "abandonado", una obra de arte.

BUY IT! This is easily the most intuitive and creative puzzle game I’ve ever played, and the sequel is even better. Even if you don’t like puzzle games, I encourage you to give it a whirl (there’s a free demo you could try.) The game is short, but who cares? If you are going to experience any one Valve game other than Team Fortress 2, make it Portal.

Portal is one of the crowning achievements of video games. The simplicity of the story and gameplay make this game entertaining for all ages, and it truly stands the test of time. It combines novel ideas with simply delightful levels, dark humor, and an encapsulating atmosphere. It is hard to say anything about Portal that hasn't been said yet, but it really is a wonder of the game industry. The little game that went so far in rebuilding a first person puzzle from the ground up, and it appeals to everybody. It's just so good.

Outside of gameplay, the tone stands out remarkably. I cannot think of another experience that conveyed isolation and loneliness better than Portal can. Playing alone in a dark room, with just the echoes of footsteps and faint tones of music fading in is magical and unforgettable. I highly recommend this game if you have not yet played it, and I also recommend it if you're interested in playing Portal 2. It's not completely necessary, but the games paired together make a much more meaningful experience.

Short and sweet, but still fun no matter how many times you play through it.  Finding shortcuts to solving difficult puzzles is always exciting, and it gets you more than ready to tackle the challenges of Portal 2.

If you haven't yet played the Portal games, you're missing out on life. 
Buy this bundled with Portal 2 (if it's still available) because once you finish Portal 1, you're going to want to jump straight into Portal 2. It also has a co-op you can play with friends (Portal 2) and design your own levels for other's to try (also Portal 2). 
Oustanding series and I'd happily pay $59.99 for a Portal 3. Get on it Valve!
My first love.

Portal is a masterpiece. The puzzles are brilliant, the game has a great dark sense of humor, and the way the atmosphere of the game slowly transitions from these sqeaky clean test chambers to these dark and spooky back areas is simply astounding. One common complaint with the game is that it's too short. However, I think it's length is one of the best things about it. Has anyone stopped to think how impressive it is that a game teaches you everything you need to know about the its mechanics to point where you fully understand all of them in the end, in a game that could take under five hours to beat? I'd recommend this game to anyone and everyone.

Awesome game for people who love puzzles.

This is an awesome little game which starts off like a simple 3D puzzle game, but grows into something a lot more.. It's not very long, but definitely worth playing this before you get into Portal 2, though it's probably a bit late to be saying that now ;)

Portal is a very unique game. It features intuitive gameplay, pretty graphics, and best of all, a brand new idea. Yeah. You heard me. Something new. It's about time that someone came out with something that's never been done before, and Portal is that game. The fact that it's not a standard fps or puzzle game automatically puts it in my game library. Now before I get on too much of a rant about how few original video games there are coming out, let's get on to the game itself. The graphics, as previously stated, are quite pretty, but nothing special. The gameplay, however, is phenominal! I very much enjoyed the puzzles and the new idea of a gun that shoots portals that you can use. The puzzles were hard, but not so hard that I would RQ or have to look it up. The storyline is an intersting one, but I personally don't feel it's worth mentioning any more than saying that it wasn't crappy. My complaint about this game is the time it takes to beat it. It only took me about 2 hours to beat it, and although I'm typically good at strategy/puzzle games, it still should've taken me longer to complete the main story. I prefer at least 3-4 hours of gameplay on games that aren't puzzle games. If they are puzzle, I EXPECT at least 5 hours because I want the puzzles to challenge me. That being said, the small amount of game time left me feeling empty. This is my only main complaint though, so that allows me to give Portal a 7.5/10. I would love to see more games take an idea, such as portals, that we have known about for years and put that into a game. [b]7.5/10[/b]

If your still thinking of purchasing Portal, all I can say is.. HOW COME YOU HAVEN'T ?! It's worth every penny! Not only is it humerous but it's also challenging, addicting and fun! Definetly a must have ! :)

A very fun an innivative gaming experiance.  I'm nit one for puzzle games, but this one is very addicting, fun, and entertaining.  It is worth the money.  However, it is on the short side and can be completed in a very short amount of time if you are a pro.  Get this game and the sequel.  They are worth the time and money.
Must have!
Great game mechanics and awesome puzzles.

Portal and Portal 2 are simply brilliant.  Unlike anything you have ever played before.  Clever puzzles and great storylines.  They are two of my top favorite games of all time.  Imagine yourself trapped in a strange, immense laboratory.  You are the lab rat, and a robotic voice leads you from test chamber to chamber.  You must escape each one with your portal gun.  Yes, your gun creates portals through which you can walk.  Just when you think the game is going one way, you learn that this facility is not what you think.  And from there the story gets really interesting.  5 stars, 10 out of 10.  A welcome break from your everyday mindless, kill 'em all shooter.

What to say about one the most celebrated games of the last decade?  Portal is a first-person-puzzler/platformer with an engaging story for only having a single significant voice actor.  Of course Valve are no strangers to crafting stories despite silent protagonists but if you are coming to the series for the first time, it is the slow creep of the story, slight errors and issues that build an atmosphere.  I prefer this to it's sequel which in my opinion was heavy handed and bloated by comparision.  While replaying some chambers for challenges i noticed all kinds of foreshadowing I had missed playing through originally.

The challenges themselves add a few hours extra playtime and can get you thinking about a single chamber in very different ways when you are trying for least steps or least time.  Although nothing major I was pleasently surprised about how it forced me to think and to get several different playstyles out of the portal gun mechanic.

Without foaming and declaring this the best game ever, I would say it is definitely worth a few hours of your time.
good game

Puzzle game. Don't like puzzles? then gtfo bruh. Okay, even if you aren't particularly fond of puzzles and what not, you could still really enjoy this game. They get noticibly harder, which just makes for better gameplay and some ouzzle induced headaches. but it's worth it. deffinant reccomend.

It's a fun game. Not as fun as the second, but it still has it's own nice moments. Although there isn't much to do after the main story and the most laughs you'll get are from GLaDOS either malfunctioning or trying to kill you, I still liked the game and played it all the way through. The first few levels are easy, but the later stages have more challenging puzzles and turrets to shoot you. It doesn't have as many jokes or as many characters (it's only Chell and GLaDOs) it could be fun, and if you're like me and played Portal 2 first, you'll probably notice that it's a little different than the first Portal. Nothing too bad, I don't have any legitimate complaints, and it is a fun game. It is also the first game where you break physics in half with 2 portals and a portal gun.
There is a reason this game is so beloved by all, just play it already.
